page.title: 20Brecon Byelection July 4 '85
page.content: {1983 General Election:}T.E.Hooson(Con) 18,225; D.R.Morris (Lab) 9471; R.A. Livesey (Lib) 9226; Mrs S.Meredudd (Plaid Cymru) 640; R.G.W.P.Booth(Ind) 278.{Majority:}8,784. The campaign was most interesting, and Brecon has never had such a large number of notable figures walking thourgh the town, canvassing and holding meetings. Among these were Norman Tebbit, Michael Heseltine,Leon Brittan,Nicholas Edwards,David Steele, David Owen, Shirley Williams, Dennis Healey, Neal Kinnock - and many T.V. political commentators,reporters, etc. The day of the results witnessed the centre of Brecon closed to traffic and thronging with over 1000 people, patiently awaiting the result. It came after a recount, at 1.45 pm, and it was Mr Livesey,tall and pale who raised his arms in triumph.
